name: Fuji Provia 100F
about: Highly Linear. Maintains a 1:1 reciprocity relationship up to 128 seconds. Statistical compensation is unnecessary within this range.

name: Fuji Velvia 50
about: Low-Speed Efficiency. Exceptional resistance to failure for a low-ISO film. Requires only minor adjustment for exposures up to 1 minute.

name: Ilford HP5 Plus
about: Consistent Decay. Follows a predictable power-law curve starting at 1s. Factor is derived directly from Ilfordâ€™s published Schwarzschild exponents.

name: Ilford FP4 Plus
about: Traditional Grain Curve. More efficient than its faster counterpart (HP5), showing a slightly shallower failure rate in mid-length exposures.

name: Ilford Delta 100
about: Tabular Precision. Exhibits a very stable failure curve. Consistent with modern Ilford sensitometric standards.

name: Ilford Delta 3200
about: Steep High-Speed Curve. Despite high nominal speed, sensitivity loss is rapid. Exposure times climb quickly once the meter exceeds 1 second.

name: Kodak T-Max 100
about: Modern Grain Efficiency. Tabular-grain structure provides high efficiency at low light levels, requiring less compensation than traditional grains.

name: Kodak T-Max 400
about: High-Speed Efficiency. Maintains the same efficient Schwarzschild exponent as T-Max 100, making it one of the most efficient 400 ISO films.

name: Kodak Tri-X 400
about: Traditional Professional Curve. A well-documented baseline for traditional grain. Exhibits predictable, moderate sensitivity loss.

name: Kodak Portra 400
about: Standard Color Curve. Field-verified 1.35 factor ensures shadow detail is maintained despite the lack of modern factory data.

name: Kodak Ektar 100
about: Low-Light Optimized Color. Exhibits a shallower failure curve than the Portra series, losing sensitivity more slowly during landscapes.

name: CineStill 800T
about: Tungsten Cinema Baseline. Derived from Vision3 500T. Reliable for urban night photography; shadow detail is preserved with a 1.34 factor.

name: Kodak Gold 200
about: Consumer Linear Curve. Reliable for dusk shots. Note potential minor color drift toward yellow/warmth in exposures exceeding 2 minutes.

name: Fomapan 100
about: Aggressive Failure. High rate of sensitivity loss. Even short metered times require substantial increases to avoid underexposure.

name: Lomo Color 800
about: High Speed Baseline. Exhibits moderate reciprocity failure. Reliable for handheld available light and short-duration tripod work.
